# sortingMode

**Instance Property**

The mode defining the order in which SceneKit renders the system’s particles.

## Declaration

```swift
var sortingMode: SCNParticleSortingMode { get set }
```

## Discussion

Together with the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/blendMode] property, sorting modes affect the appearance of overlapping particle images when rendered.

For possible sorting modes, see [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSortingMode]. The default value is [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSortingMode/none], specifying that SceneKit may render particles in arbitrary order.

## Managing Particle Rendering

- **blendMode**: The blending mode for compositing particle images into the rendered scene.
- **SCNParticleBlendMode**: Options for combining source and destination pixel colors when compositing particles during rendering, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/blendMode] property.
- **orientationMode**: The mode defining whether and how particles may rotate.
- **SCNParticleOrientationMode**: Options for restricting the orientation of particles, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/orientationMode] property.
- **SCNParticleSortingMode**: Options for the rendering order of particles, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNParticleSystem/sortingMode] property.
- **isLightingEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit applies lighting to particle images when rendering.
- **isBlackPassEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit renders particles in black before rendering the particle image.
